measure.name: build_residential_hpxml
measure.modeler_description: The measure handles geometry by 1) translating high-level geometry inputs (conditioned floor area, number of stories, etc.) to 3D closed-form geometry in an OpenStudio model and then 2) mapping the OpenStudio surfaces to HPXML surfaces (using surface type, boundary condition, area, orientation, etc.). Like surfaces are collapsed into a single surface with aggregate surface area. Note: OS-HPXML default values can be found in the documentation or can be seen by using the 'apply_defaults' argument.

argument.name: hpxml_path
argument.description: Absolute/relative path of the HPXML file.

argument.name: simulation_control_timestep
argument.description: The timestep for the simulation; defaults to hourly calculations for fastest runtime.

argument.name: simulation_control_run_period
argument.description: Enter a date range like 'Mar 1 - May 31'. Defaults to the entire year.

argument.name: location_zip_code
argument.description: Zip code of the home address. Either this or the EnergyPlus Weather (EPW) File Path input below must be provided.

argument.name: location_epw_path
argument.description: Path to the EPW file. Either this or the Zip Code input above must be provided.

argument.name: location_site_type
argument.description: The terrain/shielding of the home, for the infiltration model. Defaults to 'Suburban, Normal' for single-family detached and manufactured home and 'Suburban, Well-Shielded' for single-family attached and apartment units.

argument.name: location_soil_type
argument.description: The soil and moisture type.

argument.name: building_year_built
argument.description: The year the building was built.

argument.name: geometry_unit_type
argument.description: The type of dwelling unit and number of stories. Includes conditioned attics and excludes conditioned basements.

argument.name: geometry_attached_walls
argument.description: For single-family attached and apartment units, the location(s) of the attached walls.

argument.name: geometry_unit_conditioned_floor_area
argument.description: The total floor area of the unit's conditioned space (including any conditioned basement/attic floor area).

argument.name: geometry_unit_aspect_ratio
argument.description: The ratio of front/back wall length to left/right wall length for the unit, excluding any protruding garage wall area.

argument.name: geometry_unit_direction
argument.description: Direction of the front of the unit.

argument.name: geometry_unit_num_bedrooms
argument.description: The number of bedrooms in the unit.

argument.name: geometry_unit_num_bathrooms
argument.description: The number of bathrooms in the unit. Defaults to NumberofBedrooms/2 + 0.5.

argument.name: geometry_unit_num_occupants
argument.description: The number of occupants in the unit. Defaults to an *asset* calculation assuming standard occupancy, in which various end use defaults (e.g., plug loads, appliances, and hot water usage) are calculated based on Number of Bedrooms and Conditioned Floor Area. If provided, an *operational* calculation is instead performed in which the end use defaults reflect real-world data (where possible).

argument.name: geometry_ceiling_height
argument.description: Average distance from the floor to the ceiling.

argument.name: geometry_garage_type
argument.description: The type of attached garage. Only applies to single-family detached units.

argument.name: geometry_foundation_type
argument.description: The foundation type of the building. Garages are assumed to be over slab-on-grade.

choice.value: Detailed Example: Basement, Unconditioned, 7.25 ft Height, 8 in Above-Grade, 9 in Rim Joists
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: Basement, Unconditioned, 7.25 ft Height, 8 in Above-Grade, 9 in Rim Joists

choice.value: Detailed Example: Basement, Conditioned, 7.25 ft Height, 8 in Above-Grade, 9 in Rim Joists
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: Basement, Conditioned, 7.25 ft Height, 8 in Above-Grade, 9 in Rim Joists

choice.value: Detailed Example: Basement, Conditioned, 5 ft Height
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: Basement, Conditioned, 5 ft Height

argument.name: geometry_attic_type
argument.description: The attic/roof type of the building.

argument.name: geometry_roof_pitch
argument.description: The roof pitch of the attic. Ignored if the building has a flat roof.

argument.name: geometry_eaves
argument.description: The type of eaves extending from the roof.

argument.name: geometry_neighbor_buildings
argument.description: The presence and geometry of neighboring buildings, for shading purposes.

choice.value: Detailed Example: Left/Right at 25ft, Front/Back at 80ft, 12ft Height
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: Left/Right at 25ft, Front/Back at 80ft, 12ft Height

argument.name: geometry_window_areas_or_wwrs
argument.description: The amount of window area on the unit's front/back/left/right facades. Use a comma-separated list like '0.2, 0.2, 0.1, 0.1' to specify Window-to-Wall Ratios (WWR) or '108, 108, 72, 72' to specify absolute areas. If a facade is adiabatic, the value will be ignored.

argument.name: geometry_skylight_areas
argument.description: The amount of skylight area on the unit's front/back/left/right roofs. Use a comma-separated list like '50, 0, 0, 0'.

argument.name: geometry_door_area
argument.description: The area of the opaque door(s). Any door glazing (e.g., sliding glass doors) should be captured as window area.

argument.name: enclosure_floor_over_foundation
argument.description: The type and insulation level of the floor over the foundation (e.g., crawlspace or basement).

choice.value: Detailed Example: Wood Frame, Uninsulated, 2x6, 24 in o.c., 10% Framing, No Carpet/Subfloor
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: Wood Frame, Uninsulated, 2x6, 24 in o.c., 10% Framing, No Carpet/Subfloor

choice.value: Detailed Example: Wood Frame, R-11, 2x6, 24 in o.c., 13% Framing, No Carpet/Subfloor
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: Wood Frame, R-11, 2x6, 24 in o.c., 13% Framing, No Carpet/Subfloor

choice.value: Detailed Example: Wood Frame, R-11, 2x6, 24 in o.c., 10% Framing, No Carpet/Subfloor
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: Wood Frame, R-11, 2x6, 24 in o.c., 10% Framing, No Carpet/Subfloor

argument.name: enclosure_floor_over_garage
argument.description: The type and insulation level of the floor over the garage.

choice.value: Detailed Example: Wood Frame, Uninsulated, 2x6, 24 in o.c., 10% Framing, No Carpet/Subfloor
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: Wood Frame, Uninsulated, 2x6, 24 in o.c., 10% Framing, No Carpet/Subfloor

choice.value: Detailed Example: Wood Frame, R-11, 2x6, 24 in o.c., 13% Framing, No Carpet/Subfloor
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: Wood Frame, R-11, 2x6, 24 in o.c., 13% Framing, No Carpet/Subfloor

choice.value: Detailed Example: Wood Frame, R-11, 2x6, 24 in o.c., 10% Framing, No Carpet/Subfloor
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: Wood Frame, R-11, 2x6, 24 in o.c., 10% Framing, No Carpet/Subfloor

argument.name: enclosure_foundation_wall
argument.description: The type and insulation level of the foundation walls.

choice.value: Solid Concrete, Whole Wall, R-10.2, Interior
choice.display_name: Solid Concrete, Whole Wall, R-10.2, Interior

choice.value: Concrete Block Foam Core, Whole Wall, R-18.9
choice.display_name: Concrete Block Foam Core, Whole Wall, R-18.9

argument.name: enclosure_rim_joist
argument.description: The type and insulation level of the rim joists.

choice.value: Detailed Example: Uninsulated, Fiberboard Sheathing, Hardboard Siding
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: Uninsulated, Fiberboard Sheathing, Hardboard Siding

choice.value: Detailed Example: R-11, Fiberboard Sheathing, Hardboard Siding
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: R-11, Fiberboard Sheathing, Hardboard Siding

argument.name: enclosure_slab
argument.description: The type and insulation level of the slab. Applies to slab-on-grade as well as basement/crawlspace foundations. Under Slab insulation is placed horizontally from the edge of the slab inward. Perimeter insulation is placed vertically from the top of the slab downward. Whole Slab insulation is placed horizontally below the entire slab area.

choice.value: Detailed Example: Perimeter, 2ft, R-5, 100% R-2.08 Carpet
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: Perimeter, 2ft, R-5, 100% R-2.08 Carpet

choice.value: Detailed Example: Whole Slab, R-5, 100% R-2.5 Carpet
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: Whole Slab, R-5, 100% R-2.5 Carpet

argument.name: enclosure_ceiling
argument.description: The type and insulation level of the ceiling (attic floor).

choice.value: Detailed Example: R-11, 2x6, 24 in o.c., 10% Framing
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: R-11, 2x6, 24 in o.c., 10% Framing

choice.value: Detailed Example: R-19, 2x6, 24 in o.c., 10% Framing
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: R-19, 2x6, 24 in o.c., 10% Framing

choice.value: Detailed Example: R-19 + R-38, 2x6, 24 in o.c., 10% Framing
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: R-19 + R-38, 2x6, 24 in o.c., 10% Framing

argument.name: enclosure_roof
argument.description: The type and insulation level of the roof.

choice.value: Detailed Example: Uninsulated, 0.5 in plywood, 0.25 in asphalt shingle
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: Uninsulated, 0.5 in plywood, 0.25 in asphalt shingle

argument.name: enclosure_roof_material
argument.description: The material type and color of the roof.

argument.name: enclosure_radiant_barrier
argument.description: The type of radiant barrier in the attic.

argument.description: The type and insulation level of the walls.

argument.description: The insulation level of the wall continuous insulation. The R-value of the continuous insulation will be ignored if a wall option with an IECC U-factor is selected.

argument.name: enclosure_wall_siding
argument.description: The type, color, and insulation level of the wall siding. The R-value of the siding will be ignored if a wall option with an IECC U-factor is selected.

argument.name: enclosure_window_natural_ventilation
argument.description: The amount of natural ventilation from occupants opening operable windows when outdoor conditions are favorable.

argument.name: enclosure_window_interior_shading
argument.description: The type of window interior shading. If shading coefficients are selected, note they indicate the reduction in solar gain (e.g., 0.7 indicates 30% reduction).

argument.name: enclosure_window_exterior_shading
argument.description: The type of window exterior shading. If shading coefficients are selected, note they indicate the reduction in solar gain (e.g., 0.7 indicates 30% reduction).

argument.name: enclosure_window_insect_screens
argument.description: The type of window insect screens.

argument.name: enclosure_window_storm
argument.description: The type of storm window.

argument.name: enclosure_overhangs
argument.description: The type of window overhangs.

choice.value: Detailed Example: 1.5ft, Back/Left/Right Windows, 2ft Offset, 4ft Window Height
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: 1.5ft, Back/Left/Right Windows, 2ft Offset, 4ft Window Height

choice.value: Detailed Example: 2.5ft, Front Windows, 1ft Offset, 5ft Window Height
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: 2.5ft, Front Windows, 1ft Offset, 5ft Window Height

argument.name: enclosure_skylight
argument.description: The type of skylights.

argument.name: enclosure_door
argument.description: The type of doors.

argument.name: enclosure_air_leakage
argument.description: The amount of air leakage coming from outside. If a qualitative leakiness description (e.g., 'Average') is selected, the Year Built of the home is also required.

argument.name: hvac_heating_system
argument.description: The type and efficiency of the heating system. Use 'None' if there is no heating system or if there is a heat pump serving a heating load.

choice.value: Detailed Example: Central Furnace, 92% AFUE, 600 Btu/hr Pilot Light
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: Central Furnace, 92% AFUE, 600 Btu/hr Pilot Light

choice.value: Detailed Example: Floor Furnace, 80% AFUE, 600 Btu/hr Pilot Light
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: Floor Furnace, 80% AFUE, 600 Btu/hr Pilot Light

choice.value: Detailed Example: Boiler, 92% AFUE, 600 Btu/hr Pilot Light
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: Boiler, 92% AFUE, 600 Btu/hr Pilot Light

argument.name: hvac_heating_system_fuel
argument.description: The fuel type of the heating system. Ignored for ElectricResistance.

argument.name: hvac_heating_system_capacity
argument.description: The output capacity of the heating system.

choice.value: Detailed Example: Autosize, 90% Multiplier, 45 kBtu/hr Limit
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: Autosize, 90% Multiplier, 45 kBtu/hr Limit

choice.value: Detailed Example: Autosize, 140% Multiplier, 45 kBtu/hr Limit
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: Autosize, 140% Multiplier, 45 kBtu/hr Limit

argument.description: The fraction of the heating load served by the heating system.

argument.name: hvac_cooling_system
argument.description: The type and efficiency of the cooling system. Use 'None' if there is no cooling system or if there is a heat pump serving a cooling load.

choice.value: Detailed Example: Central AC, SEER2 13.4, Absolute Detailed Performance
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: Central AC, SEER2 13.4, Absolute Detailed Performance

choice.value: Detailed Example: Autosize, 170% Multiplier, 3.0 tons Limit
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: Autosize, 170% Multiplier, 3.0 tons Limit

argument.name: hvac_heat_pump_heating_load_served
argument.display_name: HVAC: Heat Pump Fraction Heat Load Served
argument.description: The fraction of the heating load served by the heat pump.

argument.name: hvac_heat_pump_cooling_load_served
argument.display_name: HVAC: Heat Pump Fraction Cool Load Served
argument.description: The fraction of the cooling load served by the heat pump.

argument.name: hvac_heat_pump_temperatures
argument.description: Specifies the minimum compressor temperature and/or maximum HP backup temperature. If both are the same, a binary switchover temperature is used.

choice.value: 30F Min Compressor Temp, 30F Max HP Backup Temp
choice.display_name: 30F Min Compressor Temp, 30F Max HP Backup Temp

choice.value: 35F Min Compressor Temp, 35F Max HP Backup Temp
choice.display_name: 35F Min Compressor Temp, 35F Max HP Backup Temp

choice.display_name: Detailed Example: 25F Min Compressor Temp, 45F Max HP Backup Temp

argument.name: hvac_heat_pump_backup
argument.description: The type and efficiency of the heat pump backup. Use 'None' if there is no backup heating. If Backup Type is Separate Heating System, Heating System 2 is used to specify the backup.

argument.name: hvac_heat_pump_backup_capacity
argument.description: The output capacity of the heat pump backup if there is integrated backup heating.

choice.value: Detailed Example: Autosize, 90% Multiplier, 45 kBtu/hr Limit
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: Autosize, 90% Multiplier, 45 kBtu/hr Limit

argument.name: hvac_geothermal_loop
argument.description: The geothermal loop configuration if there's a ground-to-air heat pump.

choice.value: Detailed Example: Lopsided U Configuration, 10 Boreholes
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: Lopsided U Configuration, 10 Boreholes

argument.name: hvac_heating_system_2
argument.description: The type and efficiency of the second heating system. If a heat pump is specified and the backup type is 'separate', this heating system represents the 'separate' backup heating.

choice.value: Detailed Example: Central Furnace, 92% AFUE, 600 Btu/hr Pilot Light
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: Central Furnace, 92% AFUE, 600 Btu/hr Pilot Light

choice.value: Detailed Example: Floor Furnace, 80% AFUE, 600 Btu/hr Pilot Light
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: Floor Furnace, 80% AFUE, 600 Btu/hr Pilot Light

choice.display_name: Detailed Example: Boiler, 92% AFUE, 600 Btu/hr Pilot Light

argument.name: hvac_heating_system_2_fuel
argument.description: The fuel type of the second heating system. Ignored for ElectricResistance.

argument.name: hvac_heating_system_2_capacity
argument.description: The output capacity of the second heating system.

choice.value: Detailed Example: Autosize, 90% Multiplier, 45 kBtu/hr Limit
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: Autosize, 90% Multiplier, 45 kBtu/hr Limit

choice.value: Detailed Example: Autosize, 140% Multiplier, 45 kBtu/hr Limit

argument.name: hvac_heating_system_2_heating_load_served
argument.display_name: HVAC: Heating System 2 Fraction Heat Load Served
argument.description: The fraction of the heating load served by the second heating system.

argument.name: hvac_control_heating_weekday_setpoint
argument.display_name: HVAC Control: Heating Weekday Setpoint Schedule
argument.description: Specify the constant or 24-hour comma-separated weekday heating setpoint schedule.

argument.name: hvac_control_heating_weekend_setpoint
argument.display_name: HVAC Control: Heating Weekend Setpoint Schedule
argument.description: Specify the constant or 24-hour comma-separated weekend heating setpoint schedule.

argument.name: hvac_control_cooling_weekday_setpoint
argument.display_name: HVAC Control: Cooling Weekday Setpoint Schedule
argument.description: Specify the constant or 24-hour comma-separated weekday cooling setpoint schedule.

argument.name: hvac_control_cooling_weekend_setpoint
argument.display_name: HVAC Control: Cooling Weekend Setpoint Schedule
argument.description: Specify the constant or 24-hour comma-separated weekend cooling setpoint schedule.

argument.name: hvac_control_heating_season_period
argument.description: Enter a date range like 'Nov 1 - Jun 30'. Defaults to year-round heating availability.

argument.name: hvac_control_cooling_season_period
argument.description: Enter a date range like 'Jun 1 - Oct 31'. Defaults to year-round cooling availability.

argument.name: hvac_ducts
argument.description: The leakage to outside and insulation level of the ducts.

choice.value: Detailed Example: 4 CFM25 per 100ft2 (75% Supply), R-4
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: 4 CFM25 per 100ft2 (75% Supply), R-4

choice.value: Detailed Example: 5 CFM50 per 100ft2 (75% Supply), R-4
choice.display_name: Detailed Example: 5 CFM50 per 100ft2 (75% Supply), R-4

argument.name: hvac_ducts_supply_location
argument.description: The primary location of the supply ducts. The remainder of the supply ducts are assumed to be in conditioned space. Defaults based on the foundation/attic/garage type.

argument.name: hvac_ducts_return_location
argument.description: The primary location of the return ducts. The remainder of the return ducts are assumed to be in conditioned space. Defaults based on the foundation/attic/garage type.

argument.name: ventilation_mechanical
argument.description: The type of mechanical ventilation system used for whole building ventilation.

argument.name: ventilation_kitchen
argument.description: The type of kitchen exhaust fan used for local ventilation.

argument.name: ventilation_bathroom
argument.description: The type of bathroom exhaust fans used for local ventilation.

argument.name: ventilation_whole_house_fan
argument.description: The type of whole house fans used for seasonal cooling load reduction.

argument.name: misc_television
argument.description: The amount of television usage, relative to the national average.

argument.name: misc_plug_loads
argument.description: The amount of additional plug load usage, relative to the national average.

argument.name: misc_well_pump
argument.description: The amount of well pump usage, relative to the national average.

argument.name: misc_electric_vehicle_charging
argument.description: The amount of EV charging usage, relative to the national average. Only use this if a detailed EV & EV charger were not otherwise specified.

argument.name: misc_grill
argument.description: The amount of outdoor gas grill usage, relative to the national average.

argument.name: misc_gas_lighting
argument.description: The amount of gas lighting usage, relative to the national average.

argument.name: misc_fireplace
argument.description: The amount of fireplace usage, relative to the national average. Fireplaces can also be specified as heating systems that meet a portion of the heating load.

argument.description: The type of pool (pump & heater).

argument.description: Absolute/relative paths of csv files containing user-specified detailed schedules, if desired. Use a comma-separated list for multiple files.

argument.name: additional_properties
argument.description: Additional properties specified as key-value pairs (i.e., key=value). If multiple additional properties, use a |-separated list. For example, 'LowIncome=false|Remodeled|Description=2-story home in Denver'. These properties will be stored in the HPXML file under /HPXML/SoftwareInfo/extension/AdditionalProperties.

argument.name: whole_sfa_or_mf_building_sim
argument.description: Set true if creating an HPXML file to simulate a whole single-family attached or multifamily building with multiple dwelling units within. If an HPXML file already exists at the specified HPXML File Path, a new HPXML Building element describing the current dwelling unit will be appended to this HPXML file.

argument.name: combine_like_surfaces
argument.description: If true, combines like surfaces to simplify the HPXML file generated.

argument.name: apply_defaults
argument.description: If true, applies OS-HPXML default values to the HPXML output file. Setting to true will also force validation of the HPXML output file before applying OS-HPXML default values.

argument.name: apply_validation
argument.description: If true, validates the HPXML output file. Set to false for faster performance. Note that validation is not needed if the HPXML file will be validated downstream (e.g., via the HPXMLtoOpenStudio measure).
